channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Charity worker Pen Farthing caught up in Kabul attack
item.description: The ex-Royal Marine, who was near to the airport explosions, describes how "all hell broke loose".

item.title: Twelve-year-old boy makes Â£290,000 from whale NFTs
item.description: Benyamin Ahmed created a set of more than 3,000 whale images and sold digital tokens of them.

item.title: Man charged with contaminating supermarket goods
item.description: The 37-year-old was held after incidents at three stores in west London on Wednesday evening.

item.title: Kingswinford: Car reached 96mph before crash that killed four
item.description: A Skoda Fabia, driven by Joshua Parkes ploughed through a lamppost and hit a tree, an inquest hears.

item.title: Autistic teen posts video about struggles with system
item.description: Autistic teen posted a video about lack of support in health and social care system before he died.

item.title: Bournemouth park busker pinned to floor by police
item.description: Videos of the incident show the busker's face covered in blood after being forced to the floor.

item.title: Quadruplets graduate from Oxford Brookes University
item.description: Ayah, Abdelrahim, Osama, and Ahmad Shaaban graduate from Oxford Brookes at the same time.

item.title: Liverpool hospitals warned over A&E safety by watchdog
item.description: Patients are not being assessed quickly enough at two Liverpool hospitals, a watchdog says.

item.title: Manchester man who fired shots at graveyard mourners jailed
item.description: Mohammed Umar, 24, fired shots at people gathered at Gorton Cemetery in Manchester in April 2020.

item.title: Lisa Shaw: Presenter's death due to complications of Covid vaccine
item.description: Lisa Shaw developed headaches shortly after being vaccinated against Covid-19, an inquest hears.

item.title: 'Shocking' Hull A63 crossing attempt caught on CCTV
item.description: Footage shows the man squeezing through the central reservation as traffic passes just feet away.

item.title: Covid jab side-effects 'mild' for at-risk children
item.description: Parents should be reassured by the findings, Bristol doctors say, following a small study.

item.title: Hundreds of fish die after huge Coventry warehouse fire
item.description: An investigation is probing whether water run-off from the warehouse blaze polluted a nearby lake.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Maisie Summers-Newton's family 'proud' of gold medal
item.description: Maisie, 19, has "done us all and herself proud," says mum as she claims a medal in Tokyo.

item.title: Cheshire man cycling 274 miles after brain tumour recovery
item.description: Darren Buckley is cycling the distance which represents 10% of Brain Tumour Research's daily costs.

item.title: Paralympics: Family joy at Dame Sarah Storey's 15th gold
item.description: Barney Storey says watching his wife win her 15th Paralympic gold medal from home was "surreal".

item.title: Blackpool man has Lake District tattoo so he 'can always see the fells'
item.description: A man from Blackpool has had the outline of a view of the Lake District fells tattooed on his arm.

item.title: Afghanistan: Former interpreter fears for family
item.description: Mohammed, 27, escaped to Lancaster in July before the Taliban took over his home country.

item.title: 'Incredible' mass gathering of spider crabs in Falmouth
item.description: Matt Slater said filming the crabs off the coast of Falmouth was an "incredible experience".

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City footballer charged with rape
item.description: Defender Benjamin Mendy is charged with four counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Missing chef search prompts new information
item.description: News of a search linked to Claudia Lawrence's unsolved 2009 disappearance yields new information.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand attends court as fan denies racist abuse
item.description: Jamie Arnold is set to stand trial next year accused of racially abusing the ex-England footballer.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root's third century in three Tests punishes tourists
item.description: England captain Joe Root continues his stellar form with yet another magnificent century to flatten India on day two of the third Test at Headingley.

item.title: T20 Blast: Tom Abell's 78 not out takes Somerset past Lancashire Lightning in quarter-final
item.description: Somerset beat Lancashire by seven wickets to reach T20 Blast Finals Day thanks to Tom Abell's unbeaten 78.

item.title: Tottenham 3-0 Pacos de Ferreira (agg: 3-1): Harry Kane scores twice on return
item.description: Harry Kane scores twice on his return to the Tottenham starting line-up as Spurs overturned a first-leg deficit against Pacos de Ferreira to reach the Europa Conference League group stage.

item.title: Raducanu a win away from US Open
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu is one win away from the US Open main draw after beating Mariam Bolkvadze in the second round of qualifying.

item.title: World Cup qualifiers: Bamford gets first England call-up as Alexander-Arnold returns
item.description: Leeds United striker Patrick Bamford has received his first senior call-up for England's 2022 World Cup qualifiers.
